author: Cute.duckie
title: Feel like I was treated like a second class citizen
body:
I called NHS 24 two days ago as I had severe pain in my mouth. I got an out of hours appointment next day at Wishaw General where they extracted my tooth. However today (one day after extraction) I have excruciating pain all on right side of face including jaw and ear I haven't got a dentist yet because they can't see me until mid Feb to register me due to being busy because of covid.  
Therefore I called NHS 24 this afternoon as nothing was helping my pain and I'm in agony. I got a lovely man who explained that there was a number I could call during the day to try to get seen...he stayed on the line to check if I got help. The number was for the community dental line which sees patients that are not registered with a dentist and have urgent pain. When I spoke to them it was discovered I am registered at a dentist but I explained that it is in an area I cannot return to due to previous serious domestic issues. I was told that they couldn't just see anyone and everyone because they would be over stretched. They even checked with their clinical supervisor who said the same.....where was the compassion? My right to treatment?  
I have now been left for approx 7 hours in severe pain. I called NHS 24 again this evening at 5.17pm approx as I just can't stand the pain anymore and I was told off cos this is for when doctors and dentists are closed. I said I can't get a dentist and basically told that I need to get one as I can't keep being treated by the NHS basically (this extraction was done out of hours as I haven't got a dentist and I now have issues next day). I was told I would have to call back at 6pm, bearing in mind this was 5.17pm and its taking over an hour at a time to get through. I was told again that there was nothing they could do for me until 6pm.  
I appreciate that the community dental team have rules but I gave a valid reason as to why I couldn't go to my registered dentist of over 2 years ago because of covid and ptsd due to what happened. I have tried relentlessly to get registered in my new area, however due to covid it is impossible. As I said above it will be mid Feb before I can get registered here. Anyways I was really upset when I came off the phone and I told NHS 24 that there was nothing the community dental team could do. Its now 17.54 and I just know I'll wait ages to get through again and I'll be told they can't see me until tomorrow which means being left in severe pain for 24 hours which is cruel!

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland
St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Reviwer21
title: Very poor service at childrens speech therapy
body: I am shocked and saddened at the quality and scope of the service offered to children needing speech therapy in the Nottingham area , the service has been practically desalinated since I accessed this initially and is no longer fit for purpose . My child has not seen a therapist face to face since February 2020 despite the Therapist acknowledging he has severe and profound needs . We get a maximum of three sessions over MS Teams, despite me asking/begging specifically for in person appointment in school , the environment where my child spends most of their day . The first virtual appointment was incredibly poor , discussion only with me and no interaction at all with my child , they gave recommendations based solely on what I said , I am not a trained therapist and could also have a very different idea of what my child’s needs are versus their actual need! i have repeatedly been advised the service will no longer work through school or even discuss therapy with school unless I contact them directly to ask them to speak with school , which adds unecssary barriers to joined up working . Whilst I am pro active and am constantly calling , how many parents are unable to do so? I have asked several times for the evidence that management are referring to that supports their current model of zero face to face interaction and to add insult to injury, a 3 session max limit before a child is discharged under the guise of ‘ episodic care ‘ why is this not the 6 clinical sessions / twice termly visits that I know other children were previously offered. What model of best practise is being followed? I have contacted the royal college of speech therapy about this who are also concerned about the model of service delivery as it apparently does not follow the evidence. Managers have been brusque and dismissive when I asked to speak with them , the standard reponse from the senior staff I spoke with ignored my concerns and instead cited a generic ‘manager speak’ response about how well they feel the service is being received with high levels of parental engagement and satisfaction … I don't know which parents are rating this service so highly! I leave conversations feeling frustrated and unheard, I also worry greatly on a larger scale for those children who’s parents are less able to constantly advocate or even to call , what happens to these children? I have now decided to look into private therapy as it seems like this service views my child as a tickbox, that they feel they have ticked all boxes onlt to offer of virtual appointments only. If all staff are vaccinated and there are no lockdown restrictions, how are they justifying such a reduced service?

readBy.name: Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)

author: Lizziekay76
title: Having my mirena coil fitted
body: I was welcomed by a lovely young lady who booked me in and handed me to the care of Juliet. She took me through to a room and did my weight and height etc. She was very welcoming and put me at ease about the whole thing. After we had done what we needed to do, I was introduced to Dr Bretland, who was actually going to do the fitting of my coil. She was so very friendly and reassuring. I was a little nervous. She explained very clearly what was going to happen and walked me through everything in a manner I understood, which really did relax me a lot. While the coil was actually being fitted, she asked me repeatedly if I was ok and if she was hurting me. She told me what she was going to do before she did it. That made me feel part of it and it eased my fears. After it was all done, I was uncomfortable and had cramps. Juliet very kindly got me a glass of water and told me to wait till I was ok. All in all, it was a pleasant experience and all involved were lovely.

author: triangulumqj38
title: Colonoscopy, gastroscopy and polypectomy
body: At Barnstaple hospital, the care I received was outstanding. I was well looked after and everything was explained in detail, even though I am partly deaf. If I didn't understand the first time, they were willing to explain the second time. I had a colposcopy gastroscopy and polypectomy.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: venuspb39
title: Doctors appointment
body:
Fantastic service.
Very helpful reception staff who did her best to arrange an appointment when my gp would not see me due to Covid.
Doctor was amazing, very professional, but nothing was too much trouble…Instantly put me at ease.

author: amm25
title: Breast screening
body: Attended Ninewells Hospital for breast screening today. Very grateful that this important service is continuing during these challenging times. Special thanks to Kirsten for making the experience as painless as possible and keeping me fully informed through the whole process. Thank you!

author: teemry
title: Admission to the QEUH
body:
I had an emergency admission to the QEUH this week and cannot praise enough the care I received from my admission until discharge.  
The hospital was incredibly busy but I cannot praise enough, the care the nursing and medical staff in the Emergency Department , ARU area 5 and then ward 11D all provided.  
Also hugely appreciative of the radiology department whom I visited twice and were super efficient, reassuring and informative despite the area being constantly filled with patients. Plus the cheery porters who gave me a laugh on my moves between departments.  
Thank you for All the amazing work you continue to do every day.

author: MAT84
title: Diabetes and Podiatry services
body: I must compliment Bromley Health Care for their polite,friendly, and efficient care of my requirements. My appointments have been quickly arranged when required and the medical service excellent.

readBy.name: Imperial College London, Faculty of Medicine

author: TPPcglbrum
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Coming here was one of the best decisions
body:
I have struggled for many years with my addiction. I was ashamed and lost. Never asked for help because of the thought of being judged. But coming here was one of the best decisions.  
Ladies...  
Joanne - Recovery Coordinator  
Shamiso - Nurse  
Sian - Recovery Motivator  
Lisa - Recovery Motivator  
Helen - Health Care Assistant  
They welcomed me with warmth and understanding. We had a laugh and they lifted my spirits up when I was down. I have learned a lot about myself that I didn't know before. They taught me to be more confident.  
I hoped but didn't think that it would be possible for me to change. But now I am happier and healthier.  
Carry on ladies doing the BRILLIANT job you are doing!  
Thank you

title: Personal and reassuring service given
body: I made an online enquiry regarding having an appointment was phoned by the practice and had an appointment the following day. The doctor was so reassuring,  thorough gave excellent advice.   I felt very secure with the social distancing measures they had in place.

title: Not happy
body: I am really not happy with the service provided by this practice. I've been very patient over the last months, but recently they do not call back following e-consults that I've sent. They also don't follow up with medication prescribed to me. I've been waiting for a call from the gP for four days now, and everyday I call them and they tell me to wait as I'll be called on that same day. I understand they are very short of staff and there's the issue of staff isolating at the moment, but they could at least contact the patients to let them know that the Doctor won't be able to call them on that day, despite having an appointment booked. This has caused me  inconvenience at work as I have to make my self ready to get a phone call at any moment and for days in a row they end up not calling me. I'm changing practice.

author: omegawb57
title: Covid vaccine clinic
body: We have consistently been met by kind staff at the St Andrews covid vaccine clinic. You almost feel like you’re coming for a cup of tea rather than a jab. In this time of so many unexpected disappointments, it feels especially comforting to be cared for in this way.

title: Good OOH
body: Rang my usual practice on a Friday and was offered an appointment on Sunday with this group, they had access to my notes and my usual GP could see their notes after. Seemed to be a good/useful service.

title: Brilliant practice
body: I’ve had to use this practice a couple of times recently both for myself, and my baby. I think it’s excellent. E-consult made things very easy during the height of the pandemic (photo uploaded, phone call from GP and prescription waiting in the pharmacy all within 30 mins - amazing!), and we had a great consultation with the duty doctor today, who was lovely - very reassuring, and made you feel like she had a lot of time, despite the pressures I am sure all GPs are currently under. The reception staff have only ever been friendly and helpful. Thank you very much.

title: Great Hospital
body: Visited on December 30th, was very unwell with Covid symptoms.  The care I received was oustanding and the nurses and Doctors, paramedics and care staff are a credit to our NHS. Thank you

readBy.name: The Hillingdon Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: World Class Service
body: An enormous thank-you to the Urgent Observation Department. Totally professional, efficient and super friendly. Within a matter of an hour I had been diagnosed with bloods and xray.  Hooked up to fluids and painkillers and my covid symptoms were reduced immediately. I am in awe of the you work you guys do. Total respect.

readBy.name: Chelsea and Westminster Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Exceptional service
body: All the help and support was beyond exceptional. Every single member of staff should be proud of themselves. I will never forget the help and encouragement given to me. I wish all the best to each and every one of you. Love, Jay!

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Rose@94
title: Getting my life back on track
body: It all started when coronavirus came about. My mental health took a turn for the worst. I was consumed by anxiety and depression. I thought there was no hope. Until I met Harry, a CBT therapist he helped me get my life back on track and I will be forever grateful to him.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: CardioCare
title: Lack of gritting for ice
body: In early January my mum had an appt at New Stobhill. There was a yellow weather warning for snow ahead of today. We got to the grounds of Stobhill a little late but given the weather this was fine. Unfortunately and disappointingly the grounds of the hospital (roads and pavements) had not been gritted WHATSOEVER. We entered via the entrance at Stobhill Cottages I think it’s called but no cars, mini buses or whatsoever were getting up the hill within the grounds as it was pure ice and sheer carnage. The grounds had not been maintained in any shape or form. Patients, staff and visitors were let down. You may want to blame covid but there was no excuse for the lack of maintenance to the grounds. It took 90 minutes for me to get from the entrance to the hospital to the entrance.

title: Is Human Life worth anything anymore?
body:
A strong Title? I don't think so. I have been a patient at this Surgery since 1978, but over the last 4/5 years its services have been on a sharp decline. Now everything is put at the door of 'Coronavirus'. It's extremely difficult to get an appointment or even a phone call. I managed to get a phone appointment where the Doctor prescribed some medication. That evening I went to the Chemist to collect it, but they hadn't received the prescription. When I managed to get through to the Surgery, I was told that the Doctor had forgotten to sign the prescription so it delayed for another 24 hours.
The next day I had another phone appointment which ended up with a referral to a Hospital of my choice. I waited 8 weeks or so and rang that Hospital to see if they had received my referral. They hadn't. I rang the Surgery, only to find out that it hadn't been sent.
It finally did get sent, only to find out after another 8 weeks that the referral was sent to the wrong hospital. At each time when I rang the Surgery I requested to speak with the Practice Manager but to date she hasn't had the courtesy or time to call me. So, after waiting all these weeks and months I continue to suffer in pain every minute of the day because, from where I am sitting, there is a distinct lack of care and compassion or even understanding. They haven't even got the time to say sorry!
In the meantime I am still on the list of a Hospital that I never asked for which the Surgery was going to correct, but hasn't yet.
Is this what our National Health come down to, or is it just Dishley Grange that is giving the NHS a bad name?

author: decemberpw37
title: A nurse working non stop
body: I had to visit Glasgow Royal Infirmary today as requested by my doctor. The waiting times were bad, and even though I can understand the wait , I can still feel frustrated. Sitting in the A&E waiting room, I watched one nurse book people in , check patients minor ailments, answer queries and deal with patients for three hours. To my surprise, when I eventually got taken through to a bed in A&E, I saw the exact same women dealing with patients through here. This got me thinking that these people are trying to do such a great job in such horrendous times - they deserve a lot of credit …….. so Sister Collins in Glasgow Royal Infirmary……. Thank you.

readBy.name: Office of John Mason, MSP for Glasgow Shettleston

author: Harvey2009
title: The treatment I received was excellent
body: I was admitted to the day surgery for a repair to a broken collarbone and the treatment I received was excellent.  Nurse Amy who looked after me was so nice and made me feel so at ease as all the staff in the ward were very pleasant and helpful,  can't thank them enough .

author: earthez36
title: Unfalteringly kind staff
body:
I was diagnosed with a missed miscarriage just before Christmas and my partner and I had to visit EPU several times over the festive period.

When you receive devastating news it’s hard to imagine how anything can make things better, but every single member of staff we met were unfalteringly kind, compassionate and patient. At times it was obvious the department was extremely busy and under a lot of pressure, but the quality of care and the humanity they brought to their jobs was incredible.

Having previously felt let down by other maternity services, I know how easy it can be for professionals under pressure to lose their sense of humanity and become impatient and dismissive when patients are at their most vulnerable. Other departments could learn a lot from EPU.

author: Iantet
title: Contraceptive patch
body: The pharmacy couldn't get me anymore contraceptive patches so I made an appointment with Stafford sexual health clinic. Everyone was lovely and helpful. The nurse who did my appointment was genuinely lovely and made me feel comfortable. 10/10

author: pavocc44
title: Polite and professional staff
body: The nurses were very helpful, polite and professional. I did find it very strange that I could not confirm my follow up appointment for 4 weeks time. Instead someone will contact me in 2 weeks to arrange the appointment. It isn't good for confidentiality.

author: Robin35
title: My visit to the hospital eye clinic
body: I visited the eye clinic yesterday to have my eyes checked ready for a cataracts operation, the staff, nurses and doctor were all very kind and helpful and did not have to wait to long.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Parkperson56
title: Such poor service since merger of practices
body:
I was looking for a non urgent appointment to discuss a long term condition. I called the surgery on several occasions, on the time that my call got through to be put in the queue I waited 37 mins for it to be answered. I was advised there were no non urgent slots for two months.  
Please improve your phone line management and also please don’t use capital letters on your website, it makes it really hard to read the instructions on there.  
Please make it easier to get the relevant paperwork to allow patients to order prescriptions online.

readBy.name: Meadowgreen Health Centre & The Avenue Medical Practice

author: jiveqr43
title: Virtual visit to my father
body:
The virtual visit was well organised so that my sisters and I could speak with and see our dad.
This was excellent for us providing reassurance about his health upon seeing and talking to him when f2f visiting not permitted. My sister had this faclity from abroad which was great.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: What is going on?
body: I’ve been trying to get help from my GP practice by calling them almost every single day the whole week. It’s practically impossible to get through. The e-consult service does not work either as no contact was made so far. I’m not sure whether the same rules apply to the surgeries as for the hospitals, but I would recommend to declare a critical incident as the practice cannot handle their duties anymore.

author: jackpotjs73
title: Maternity care
body:
My sister has had severe nausea and vomiting during her pregnancy for the last 6 weeks. She is now 12 weeks pregnant and has had various antiemetics from her GP none of which helped. She was checked by her GP and found to have 3+ ketones in her urine and was correctly referred to maternity service at the Princess Royal maternity hospital in Glasgow. Her care since then has been nothing short of appalling.  
Despite being really sick she had to wait an hour and a half on her own in a waiting room that felt like a sauna. Her urine and bloods were checked then she was given a short course of IV fluids and an antiemetic injection which did not help at all. She was not scanned and had nothing rechecked before being sent home just as sick as when she went in. She asked for alternative antiemetics only to be told the doctors were too busy and she couldn’t have any for 3 days.  
A family member gave the unit a call to say she couldn’t cope without medication for the next 3 days as she is constantly sick and current treatment is not working and was told a midwife would call my sister to arrange something. That didn’t happen.  
They phoned back and eventually someone phoned my sister to say as she hadn’t yet had a scan ( which should have been done when she was in) she couldn’t be given the treatment.  
She now has 3+ ketones in her urine again which is bad for mother and baby but despite the maternity unit staff being informed of this hours ago she still has not received any contact.  
There is a ggc obsgyn handbook which sets out what should happen in this situation and those procedure were not followed. Care of patients with nausea and vomiting in pregnancy and hyperemesis gravidarum need to be reviewed in my opinion, and appropriate staff training put in place.  
If my sisters care does not improve her husband plans to take things further with the healthboard.

author: Ches Bes
title: Excellent care provided to my mother
body:
My elderly mother Helen B became seriously unwell with a chest infection and we were advised by her GP that she would need to go into hospital. My mother did not want to go into hospital so we asked about the hospital at home service. Within hours this was arranged and a specialist nurse Tracey attended.  
She was with my mum for over an hour doing lots of checks and tests, heart tracing, bloods, cognitive tests and assessing her mobility. She then explained in full, the acute care package that was to be instigated. For the next 2 weeks, every day, there was nurses, doctors, a consultant geriatrician, physiotherapists and occupational therapists visiting. She made a slow but steady recovery. After the acute phase she was discharged from hospital care & a 6 week care package was set in place.We would like to express our gratitude to all the staff that attended my mum. We were delighted with the care & attention she received from every one that visited. The staff were all kind, friendly and very courteous. A very well organised and experienced team indeed.

author: Sj2021
title: Attended for a planned section
body: Fantastic, caring team. Attended for a planned section and was brilliant from start to finish. Rachel the Anesthetist was superb and Joanne from Maternity who was with me the whole way. Many thanks to all!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Rugby
title: Attending a scan
body: My 4 month old son had to have a micturation scan, a procedure that I, as his mum, was dreading. The two radiographers that performed the scan were absolutely amazing! They interacted so well with my son and were so kind to me. They really put me at ease and took time to explain everything. It made the whole experience so much better than I ever could have imagined!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: novembermf44
title: IUD implantation
body:
I attended my appointment, in the Meadows Suite, Causeway. I wasn't nervous or anxious at all prior to the procedure. But once I found myself sitting in the chair and all prepared for the procedure to begin, I then felt uneasy and a sense of panic waved over me.  
During the procedure the panic then started to become very overbearing. I started to hear a ringing noise in my ears and my hands started to sweat. I am a nurse myself so I knew my symptoms were relating to those of an anxiety attack.  
I do not know if they realised in that moment but the Doctor, Nurse and HCA, Mandy, were absolutely amazing in talking me round. I was able to focus on the conversation, therefore diverting my attention and thus, calming myself down.  
It could of been a very different experience otherwise.  
I am so thankful to the three of them for turning what could of been a very negative experience into a positive one.  
They are a credit to their profession!

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: pyxiswb77
title: My admission to the cancer centre
body:
I recently had to spend some time in hospital (cancer centre at belfast city hospital) as I had become unwell. While I was there I received the best care better than I could have asked for! All the staff were helpful and attentive but particular mention to the physiotherapist called Mary who was involved with my care who was is great at her job. A massive thank you to her for the kindness and care she showed me throughout my admission, we worked together to overcome any problems and now I am fully independent and no longer need oxygen which was my main goal. She also provided me with some exercises for me to keep doing at home to keep me fit and active. Also the occupational therapist however I cannot remember her name , so sorry but she was also very good at what she does, I got equipment for when I went home which will make my life a lot easier  
I also would like to say thank you to all the nurses and other staff for all their help and care throughout my stay. I will hopefully not be back in hospital for a long time but at least I know that if I ever do end up in again I will be well looked after  
Thank you everyone!

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: ermitsjoe
title: No assistance with communication
body: When I have arrived at the NUH A&E for mental health issue, the A&E department was aware of my Profoundly Deafness and I require a form of communication either a BSL interpreter or Mask Removal for Lipreading but they have refused to offer me both. As I do require one of them communication methods, they have contacted the Mental health team within the hospital and they have informed A&E that I could have the masks removed so I can lipread but they refused and kept me in the department till very late morning without having any support or treatment which has affected my mental health even more because I felt even more isolated and punished by the nurses and doctors. Even tho, when I was waiting for the Mental health team, the A&E nurses have refused them to see me because I don't have the correct method of communication as they was willing for me to see them with lipreading but NUH has refused it and told me to leave.

author: BelfastMa
title: Lovely and supportive midwives
body: I went to booking appointment at Belfast Royal Maternity Hospital. The midwives were excellent. We'd had a previous complex loss and midwives were so reassuring and understanding. We were seen really quickly, midwives were all lovely and supportive.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Happy with everything
body: I arrived into hospital via A+E about 2 weeks ago. Everything has been satisfactory and I can't really complain. There is good hygiene and the care has been super. Thanks everyone!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My care has been great
body:
I have had a tingling/numb sensation in my left side side so decided to get checked out in A+E. Since arriving on the orthopaedic ward, my care has been great. The doctors are pleasant and approachable, the ward is clean and the food is good. I can't really complain! Day by day I am getting better.  
I just want to thank everyone in orthopaedics.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: bb123
title: Birth of our baby girl
body:
We welcomed our beautiful girl into the world and we cannot thank enough the midwives who looked after the three of us during our stay. Namely - Gloria, student midwife Chloe, and most of all Rebecca & student midwife Amie for ensuring our girl got into the world safely with the most amazing technique and encouragement.  
You made me feel safe and most importantly my partner who absolutely hates hospitals.  
You are real life angels and words don’t do justice for the amazing work you midwives do!

author: wezenps54
title: Self swab service
body:
I do not drive so first time they visited me was essential as i had to ask for a lift for a 90 mile round trip for covid test before my ent appointment and i was worried about doing the test myself as i had not done many and my nose was hurting hence me seeing ent.
Second time there was a local drop off  point in my nearest town so huge improvements, thank you

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Extremely caring
body: I feel I need to say how polite, caring and extremely helpful the reception staff have been…. I had to call for my Dad as he has been so poorly a couple of times last week and the last time to request a home visit and nothing was to much trouble and they kept me updated…. Can not fault the service enough especially during the difficult times we are dealing with at the moment

author: Sian27
title: Big thank you to everyone
body:
I recently gave birth to my first baby at North Devon District Hospital. Yaz and Bex from the delivery suite were absolutely amazing and made me and my husband feel very relaxed throughout the birthing process. The birth went smoothly thanks to their great knowledge and expertise, thank you both!  
All staff on Bassett ward were really helpful, caring and considerate. So a big thank you to everyone, you are all amazing and deserve the acknowledgment of how great the care is that you deliver.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Absolutely shocking Practice
body: The reception staff clearly don’t listen to patients when requesting specific types of appointments & are incompetent. They’re level of service & booking you in for the correct type of appointment  is abysmal. I wouldn’t recommend this surgery at all & if I knew how to change GP Surgery I would!!

author: Argus72
title: Friendly and attentive staff kept me informed
body:
I visited the Endoscopy Unit at QMH for a procedure on 10th January 2022  
The unit was fresh and bright with appropriate social distancing measures in place.  
The nursing staff were very friendly and attentive and kept me informed of all things relevant to my scope.  
The theatre nurses also kept me informed of what would take place before and during the procedure.  
The Consultant Physician had a first class manner and was particularly informative.  
All in all my experience was made so much easier by the combined efforts of all staff so I wish to register my thanks to everyone.

title: Well run
body: Came for my booster today had a text to say there was a clinic running had no problem making an appointment. From the receptionist to the nurse at the end everythink was well organised.. Arrived and receptionist had all relevant paper work to hand. Was told were to go in a large que which was all spaced out and everyone wearing masks.. The que moves very quickly was greeted at the end by member of staff. We're they then told you which room to go to. Was greeted at the door by my nurse who introduced herself. She explained which booster I was having and side effects ect. The whole process took around 10 minutes from entering the building.. We'll done to all the team that were on that day was very efficiently ran..

author: Carol74
title: Covid 19 Vaccine
body: I took my 12 year old to the Foyle Arena mass vaccination centre yesterday. She was nervous but wanted to get the vaccine to help keep her family and friends safe. The staff in the centre were amazing, both admin staff and clinical staff. They were so patient, caring and kind to her and made her experience so much better than she expected. Thanks so much to all the Western Trust staff that are doing amazing things in extraordinary times.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Zoe1234
title: Sexual health appointment
body: Kim was very kind, personable and friendly. Made me feel at ease and safe. 10/10 !

title: Removed from the practice
body:
Following a house move 3 miles away, i received a letter telling me I was being removed from the practice 28 days from the date of the letter which was 31/12/2021 and for me to register elsewhere. I received the letter at 4pm on Friday 7/01/2022. As it was the weekend and the letter was already dated 31/12/21 i am unable to do anything about registering until Monday 10th thereby losing almost 2 weeks of the 28 days. I will now have to take time off work to appear at a new practice. I therefore requested an extra 14 days due to the letter taking 2 weeks to action by me. This was declined.
Despite my explanation of it not being my fault. I have been with the practice 30yrs. I am awaiting 3 surgerys and take several meds. Would 14 days leave have hurt

author: mineralyd35
title: Attending physcial activity classes
body:
I underwent a procedure in July 2021 and as part of its care package the Belfast City Hospital referred me to its Physio Department to increase mobility post-procedure.  
I enrolled in a 12-week remote exercise class with Joe via Zoom. The activity class was held every Friday at 10am which was also attended by other patients.  
Joe was highly organised in his approach to every class which started at 10am and finished at 10:40am. Joe would start with warm-up exercises then moved on to general strengthening and conditioning exercises, requiring light weights for later exercises. Although I would consider myself to be reasonably fit I looked forward to each class as Joe's exercises catered for all fitness levels so I always felt I got something out of the class. Also, Joe kept the interest going with well-timed banter and I particularly enjoyed the scientific patter about the benefits of certain exercises, e.g. this exericse is good for strengthening your quads / glutes, etc.Overall, I found the class to be benefical, motivating and enjoyable. Well done to Joe for keeping it all going.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great nursing care
body:
Had day surgery and can highly recommend the care from reception to theatre and after care.
My one suggestion for improvement would be not to have to wait 5 hours from checking in. Can the time be reduced to perhaps 3 hours as it is quite nerve racking to wait such a long time. Not a criticism just a suggestion. 
Theatre staff were lovely and friendly and made me feel vey much at ease.

title: Outstanding Care
body:
Outstanding care from my plastic surgeon and his team. The staff especially on HDU were so kind and caring from the nurses to the house keepers. 
I was then transferred to L22 Plastics Ward again excellent care from all staff. 
They are all angels.

title: Great experience at Labour Ward and Postnatal Care
body:
I gave a birth to my daughter at Whittington hospital and can't say enough how thankful I'm to all hospital staff for the overall experience. I was surrounded by high professionals in a friendly atmosphere and with a great care. 
Any complications or difficulties throughout the labour were promptly escalated to a senior midwifery or doctor when needed, which followed by detailed, patient and very competent explanation of all available options which we could choose from. The overall feeling throughout this journey was more family-like, and that helped a lot emotionally as well as in regards to pain management. My husband also could feel very positive and supportive attitude from the midwifery team which made a partner birth experience - something very special to us. After giving a birth nurses in postnatal care were also very friendly and helpful which again made our time until discharge filled with support and practical advices. Staff run extra miles in order to help us to be discharged from hospital on Xmas eve, as all medical analysis were only finished late evening that day, and that made us super happy. 
I can highly recommend anyone to choose Whittington hospital for the labour with no doubts!

title: where am I?
body: I have found this surgery excellent, but my great GP has just retired - of which I wasn't notified before a few days before.  Who do I contact if I need an appointment.  I feel very isolated and there are other issues in this life apart from covid, such as mental health and other operations that have been side lined.

title: Great practice
body:
Most of reception staff helpful and polite.
I have difficulty health problems and the doctors have been very helpful weather it's been on the phone or face to face and most times I have all ways got medical assistant, never had to wait days for appointments, I like the fact you have two times you can call morning and afternoon for a appointment on that day, let's hope it continues and the level of care keeps continuing for myself and the community and the future. It's what we need a good caring surgery.

author: QueenNev
title: Professional and empathetic
body: Pamela & Angela explained what was going to happen at my dermatology minor op, and also post op care. They were really lovely and chatted away to distract me from the procedure. Very professional but also empathetic. Thanks ladies.

title: Rude receptionist
body: I called the GP surgery to be put on the list for a GP to call me back. As soon as I started talking, the receptionist cut me short and said I should go to hospital. I said that she should let me finish what I have to say because it's not appropriate for a list to A&E. Then she called me rude. She was abrupt, talking in an aggressive tone. That was not my bad first experience with the receptionists at this GP surgery and I told her so. She continued being rude. I had to mention that I'm an NHS doctor myself to be put on the GP phone call list. This is not right!

author: phoenixnw57
title: Communicating with hospital
body:
My husband has been in hospital for several weeks. He was admitted with suspected chest infection after falling out of bed at home.  
After being in for a week I was informed that he had a broken hip. This was operated on the next day. My biggest complaint is the time it takes for staff to answer the phone  
Since there is no visiting the phone is the only way to gain information. I was told he was due to be discharged. but heard nothing. I made 35 attempts to contact ward with no response on the day.  
Made further calls without success this morning. I realise the staff are very busy but this seems to be a ridiculous amount of calls with no response.

readBy.name: Norfolk Community Health and Care NHS Trust

author: Crystal Tips
title: Excellent team work.
body: My initial appointment arrived before Christmas for the end of May.  I was feeling dreadful so phoned the rheumatology department who directed me to Outpatients to try and get a cancellation.  Outpatients could not have been kinder and I was fortunate to be offered an appointment the next morning.  The rheumatology team under Mr Al-Saffar could not have been kinder or more thorough.  Because so few people are allowed into the hospital environment the waiting room was calm, felt safe and very efficient.  The Main Reception was attentive and it is so much better that the phlebotomy department is now situated in Outpatients B. I felt all my concerns were listened to and taken into account by the consultant and at last, after a long period of difficulty, I am possibly able to move forward with my problems.  I am so grateful to everyone concerned.  Many thanks.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Lisa1234
title: Great service in the x-ray department
body: I visited the x-ray department at North Manchester General Hospital this morning, 10th January 2022. All of the staff I came across were nothing but helpful and kind. I would like to thank them for doing a fantastic job.

author: Megan1991
title: The birth of my daughter
body: After having a 48 hour labour a decision was made to deliver my daughter via emergency cesarean. I had 3 midwives during my stay on the delivery suite, Margaret, Nicole and Louise, each one of them worth their weight in gold and made a difficult birthing process a lot easier due to their compassion and care. Also our anesthetist Richard was absolutely fabulous with both me and my partner and kept us so calm. And lastly the registrar Victoria who delivered our beautiful daughter safely into this world was on both days of our stint in delivery suite and couldn't have been nicer! All the staff we came across were so kind and caring! It is very clear their is huge pressure within our health service but these individuals made our experience one we will never forget and for all the right reasons. A massive thank, we will never forget the care you provided and compassion shown to us!

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: Par excellence Infectious disease team
body: We were extremely pleased with the professionalism, prompt diagnosis & management plan initiated by the infectious disease consultant & her team during a very challenging weekend in January. Forever grateful to a department that has risen to the challenges during this Covid pandemic.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Well done to meldon ward
body:
Having the experience of kingfisher ward before which was not good , I am relieved to have had my op and post op care on meldon ward 
The nurses,doctors and theatre staff were amazing against impossible odds 
Staff going off with covid and the ward full 
The remaining staff were upbeat and nothing was too much trouble 

My hope in the NHS was renewed and I did thank everyone for their amazing care 
The ward managers need to know how amazing the staff were 
I am now thankfully home and my stay and care in the middle of the covid pandemic was exceptional and something the hospital should be very proud of

readBy.name: Great Western Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Practice
body: Great Surgery, Swift appointments and very friendly staff. I have been visiting this surgery since 2 years now. The staff is very kind and welcoming.

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: ''Top class care''
body:
Following an open heart transplant at the beginning of December, I have been between the Royal in Belfast and Craigavon Area Hospital. I honestly couldn't fault CAH. My care has been tremendous, right from the HCA's to the consultants. Small things that the staff do, make all the difference. I want to thank Margaret, or as we call her ''Maggie'' for her care. I woke up this morning greeted by a cup of tea at my bedside... what more could you want! Doctor Moore has also been incredible- his positive attitude most definitely permeates across to the other staff. My care plan is made so clear and the staff are approachable. The hygiene is perfect and the food is lovely... I have paid for worse!  
I unfortunately caught Covid-19 whilst being in hospital, which was an annoyance, but the staff continued to be resilient and help me get through this struggle. The only complaint I would have would be that one of my windows doesn't close properly. This is manageable during the day but at night it is very unpleasant. I need to have three blankets over me to keep myself warm... I have circulation issues, so the cold air certainly doesn't help.  
Aside from that, I honestly couldn't thank everyone enough for my care. I will forever be grateful for the care I have received on 1 North

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Life saving
body:
Just wanted to leave a review for the maternity team and the early pregnancy assessment unit. If it was not for the consultant booking myself for an additional 28 weeks scan; identifying and acting so quickly when there was something wrong during said scan myself and partner would have lost out first child. For this we will forever be grateful. 
The maternity team were also very reassuring and helpful even if stretched staffing wise. 
We cannot thank them all enough and believe they all deserve recognition for their daily work.

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: From Xray to MRI scan via a CT scan in 53 hours
body:
I had an Xray at 11.00 am on Wednesday 24th November, expecting to be told I would get the result in a week.
But no, the Xray operator saw a problem and referred me to A & E where I was seen by an excellent doctor, who was so efficient and arranged an immediate CT scan. This confirmed the Xray operator’s concern and followed it up, after consultation with Queen Mary’s Hospital, by arranging an MRI Scan which meant a stay overnight in Carroll Ward where the care and attention was exemplary.
They couldn’t arrange the MRI scan for Thursday and it had to be done on Friday at 4.00 pm
The doctor who dealt with me on Carroll Ward was delightful, it was a pleasure to have been her patient and so clear in demonstrating a wedge fracture in my spine and the advice she gave to deal with the pain etc.
I would also like to compliment the behaviour and attitude of the night nurses who had to deal with a patient in the bed next to me in the middle of the Wednesday night. This patient swore outrageously, calling them unrepeatable names and struggled with them, while, with incredible patience they carefully cleaned and got him back to bed.
This is amazing service provided by Northwick Park hospital and I give it 5 Stars

Rodney Gross

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Fantastic Care
body:
Before I came into hospital I began to feel unwell and wanted to get to the bottom of my shortness of breath. I came in via A+E which was an eye-opener as it is such a busy place. However, considering the circumstances and the pressure that they are under, everyone was brilliant. I did have a long wait, understandably, but it meant I hadn't eaten or drank anything for hours, which was uncomfortable. I also had no pillow on my bed and didn't want to be a ''pest'' and ask.  
However, I couldn't fault the staff and the care they have provided to me. The nurses and doctors are excellent and super approachable. I am treated with the utmost respect and the staff are able to cope with the pressure so well. I am happy with how hygienic my environment is.  
I am finding it difficult to maintain my own hygiene. There are no plugs in the sink to hold water, so I can't freshen up. Even the option of a basin would be useful. Small things, like no marmalade and damp toast are just simple things that make you miss home comforts... just constructive feedback.  
Thank you so much to everyone who has helped me on 3 North.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Cedars always spot on
body:
Visited the surgery for my Covid Booster. Staff always helpful, friendly and approachable. 

Cedars always care about your health and well-being.

title: Diabetic Medicine Edgware Hospital
body: I am a type 1 diabetes sufferer (new referral) and had my first consultation here and am generally pleased with the advice and guidance from the consultation. It seems like there are quite a few different professionals specialising in this to give support according to the focus of the problem, which in my case includes related leg problems. Hopefully the follow-ups will also be helpful and I can deal with managing this condition over time.

title: Not but negatives
body: I thought hillcroft house was supposed to be there for me, but nothing but staff sickness all the time, left in the isolation in trying support myself major change#s.  I know the staff trying to help, but no focus to my care, no care planning central to my welfare as just complaints about me having go else we’re unmet needs thankfully got help for. Nothing ends argument who right or wrong.  I lost trust in the psychiatry as a patient as seam to be from a old world of authority only over my welfare no more than a submissive which put me further way from mental help as not considered unmet needs the fcan impact on my mental health. Th mental health service makes me feel worse about myself ever before. that can’t even understand the basic about me, that focus always else where for need something else has no connection with me. I have no choice to move forward with or without them and can honestly say the mental health service makes me feel even worse that I am a outcast, simple things understanding how my psychical health impacts on my mental health, every label thrown at me putting me down can be human for sake. My feeling is the mental health service is more interested in itself than me and only there as patient to meet there need exclusively and the run around can’t do in finding the mental health support, and rather be discharged in this situaion as mental health service only makes my mental health worse.

title: Great Practice
body: I am staggered to have stumbled across poor reviews for the surgery. I have been a patient there for many years have known nothing but courtesy, professionalism and friendliness from everyone that I have met.

title: Excellent doctors
body: The doctor who called me was very clear and sympathetic.  I felt he took time to listen and was very thorough in his response.

author: Katee95
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My care on 3 South
body:
I have been in since Tuesday with a suspected infection. The staff are fantastic! I can't comment on the food as I haven't been eating. The hygiene in my bay is great but the toilets are ''disgusting''. They are so unhygienic and always have an awful smell in them.  
I was initially in a side room with other people. It was such a cramped space so didn't feel safe in terms of Covid-19. I was also situated below a TV which is so dangerous. Upon requesting to go home or be moved, I was moved to a bay in the ward and am now much more content.  
I am really missing home and my child but have been lucky enough to go out to the car park and have a quick visit.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great Reception Staff
body:
Great reception staff , working under intense pressure from the public and patients , always willing to help . 

Regards 
Mr Neville Gentles

title: Positive 12 week scan experience
body: I was sick with nerves for my first scan and found receptionist friendly, booking was near enough on time, sonographer was so welcoming and put me at ease right away. So detailed and approachable so I felt like I could ask questions. I went for my blood test afterwards and they were super friendly and made the blood test quick and easy. They all must be doing so many a day but they all made a difference in how positive my experience turned out to be. Absolute professionals. Thank you!

author: Yeller
title: Had a mri scan on my head
body:
I'm clostrophobic and having the mri done was a horrendous experience - but it was needed so knew I had to carry on. That didn't stop me from panicking and acting like a baby though ( much to my embarassment).  
The radiographer was fantastic - very calming and reassuring. Even joked about how many people have had the same reaction stopping me from feeling like an idiot. Anyway just wanted to say thankyou so much but I hope I never have to have another one of them again!

author: JacksterV
title: Dermatology team at the Royal Cornwall Hospital
body:
I visited the Derma Team at the Royal Cornwall Hospital in December with 2 suspected fast growing SCC, the Consultant Dr Hadden recommended removal within a month especially as I'd had 2 BCC removed in 2019.  
As the surgeon's, Mr Armstrong, list was short for the day these were removed at 1130 on the same day. The skin lesions were removed quickly, painlessly and healed very quickly with minimal scarring requiring no further follow up treatment.  
The team Dr Hadden, Mr Armstrong and Nurses Bonnie and Karen provided a super efficient and caring service for which I'm very grateful.  
It was apparent that all the Derma team were clearly working within a highly supportive and caring culture not only with patients but as importantly with each other. The Department seemed efficient and a really great place to work which was evident on the faces of all those who work there.  
Given the pressures within the NHS and my experience of similar procedures in the private sector I can state that the differentiation by specialities provided a more efficient and effective treatment and service.  
I know this service standard in terms of timing was very fortunate for me personally and not everyone will be treated so quickly but for me this was an amazing experience for which I'm very grateful.  
Many thanks to all at the Derma Team at the Royal Cornwall Hospital, you absolutely made my Christmas.

title: Great service & well looked after
body: I visited for a pre-op consultation in November, and then had a hernia operation under local anaesthetic here. The receptionist was very warm & comforting, especially considering I was nervous. The surgeon and his team were equally excellent, very assuring, understanding & caring. They talked me through the procedure, and kept me happy with there light humour & kept me calm. All in all if I had to have any sort of surgery again I’d be sure to come back to this clinic. 5 star service & care

title: The receptionist was busy
body: I saw the doctor on 22th November.  He said he would post me referral letters for checking in hospital.  I did not receive the letters, so I inquired by phone at 1400 on 8th December.   I told the receptionist "I saw the doctor. The doctor said I should inquiry if I could not receive the referral letters within two weeks".  The receptionist replied "... thank you" and then cut the line.  On 21st December, another doctor called me and said she would prepare the referral letter.  So far, I still haven’t received the letters.  Nevertheless, I am afraid to inquiry and be cut line again.  I changed my GP.  I write down here because I would like to know if I should wait for the mail continuously or should book a new appointment with the new GP.

title: MRI scan centenary building
body:
Attended an MRI scan Sunday 9th January 2022
I was very nervous 
The staff were absolutely brilliant 
Very kind helpful and professional 
I would recommend this service and give them 100%

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust

author: Chrissie757
title: Exemplary nursing care!
body:
Apart from a 10 hour wait to be admitted, once I was on to Nutfield Ward, the nursing staff could not have been more caring, friendly, helpful and quick to help with pain relief. There is a great staff shortage at the moment, resulting from Covid and Id like to thank everyone for their care, not one mentioned the pressure they were under. As a nurse myself, I’m fully aware of staff having to do extra shifts and how hard they are working. Well done to all of you, you’re doing a magnificent job - thank you!  
[Happy with 'Treatment']

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Friendly Staff
body: I take a medication which requires blood test monitoring. I received a missed call from the surgery and a text message asking me to call and book a blood test appointment. I called the surgery back and was offered an appointment the next working day, which I had this morning. I saw one of the HCAs, who was lovely and very efficient at taking the blood samples. The appointment was also on time, and the HCA advised when and how I could get my results. On my way out the surgery, I asked the receptionist if I could book a flu vaccination as I am struggling to get one from a pharmacy and they called a colleague straight away and were able to fit me in the same day, with the same HCA that I had just seen.

title: AAU and ward 13.Superb caring people
body:
Thank you,to all the staff on AAU and ward 13,you are such caring professional people,who manage to keep.there sense of humour,through some very difficult times and yet,always manage to reassure and care,for the patients 
Thank you .
Malcolm Binns.

title: Great Experience
body: I had a great experience with Mediscan. I was given preparation ahead of my appointment which was booked promptly. At the appointment staff were very understanding and reassuring. Both the sonographer and the HCA made me feel comfortable. I was very happy with the service I received.

author: Biddy58
title: Video call to family member
body: The nurse, Aisling was very helpful and friendlyand gave the patient a good and clear explanation of what was happening and was able to update us on her care which was put us at ease. Also, this morning, Sylvia, a member of your team contacted me regarding the video call procedure, explaining all options clearly and was extremely friendly and helpful also. We genuinely appreciate the immense hard work and phenomenal work ethic displayed by everyone we have encountered. Thank you all for being so awesome at what you. Please know that we appreciate you.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Good Service
body: I received an excellent service.  Appointment was sent to me in a timely manner and I received my results the next day.

title: Great Service
body:
It was a hard time when I got a bad disease last year.
I love the way the staff treated me for the scan. 
I am fully satisfied with the procedure and professionalism. 
great people and great service

title: A good practice
body: I would highly recommend this practice in the future to family and friends. My appointment was on completed on time and I was made comfortable by both the sonographer and health care assistant.

title: Excellent care and attention
body:
My wife had a fall, visited A&E reception, and submitted her details. Within a few minutes, she was accessed and an x-ray was arranged. She had fractured a bone in her wrist, which was quickly attended to and set into a cast. The staff were so polite and helpful. 
Including waiting time and treatment her visit was under 2 hours.
Well done NewCross A&E

title: Just defer you to 111
body: Unfortunately it is almost impossible to get help from this practise.  The phone is just constantly busy in the morning and at the start of the afternoon, when they finally answer they tell you it's too late for this shift, call back at the next shift and the rigmarole begins again.  In the end you have to call 111 and go and see a walk in centre or out of hours GP.  Really poor and useless system in place.  They need to change, I really think they wouldn't get away with such dismal and abysmal service in a more affluent area.

title: Can’t fault this practice!
body: I’m new to the area and was nervous about switching doctors after reading reviews about not being able to get appointments. I had nothing to worry about, I have had no trouble getting appointments when I need them and the clinicians I have spoken too have been so lovely, and very thorough with investigating what’s going on with me. The reception staff are also lovely. Thanks very much Wilnecote Surgery, I feel very well looked after.

title: excellent service
body: I visited my GP on a Tuesday and referred for a scan. I was offered an appointment for Thursday which  was great seen as in the past i have had to wait weeks to get a appointment booked. The booking process was very easy and informative. I was offered a appointment at my local surgery which is walking distance from my house, on arrival of the scan the health care assistant and doctor were very polite and helpful. I was very scared to have this scan but the health care professionals made me feel at ease. Definitely recommend this service.

title: For Lead Receptionist & Receptionist Administrator
body: This is especially for the lead receptionist at the Js Medical Practice. What an incredible and fully competent person. She is absolutely fantastic at her job. She has a great rapport on the phone and knows how to communicate with care, compassion and professionalism. She does her job incredibly well and treats the patients with kindness & respect. She is a role model for all other receptionists alongside another superstar who is the receptionist administrator.  It is a great relief to know that at least these people keep the standards where they should be.

title: Good Service
body: Staff were friendly and very helpful. They answered all my questions. They dealt with me with professionalism. I would recommend this service as I was happy with my experience.

title: Outstanding practice
body:
From the very first contact with the MHT for older people my whole experience has been amazing. I can't thank them all enough on their compassion, understanding, care and kindness to name just a few of their fabulous attributes. I was very reluctant about asking for help at the time and didn't expect anything let alone the whole panoply of help that happened so quickly and humanely. I felt above anything else believed and to me this means more than anything. The whole ethos of this remarkable team is so far away from many many experiences I have had in my years in and out of the MH system. They gave me hope from the outset and the knowledge that they would always be there has been a great comfort. Plus the knowledge that should I need help in the future I now know that the hoops and obstacles that have blighted my attempts to be referred back into MH over the years and would in the main make me reluctant to ask for help are not in the main required by MH for Older People. This ethos means that for the first time I am feeling fine about being discharged with the full knowledge that their safety net will catch me should I fall. Everyone I have worked with whether on a regular basis or only on occasion has to me the core elements that makes any health professional effective and successful at their job and is the combination of humanity and being down to earth. Both these elements are to be found in spades within this team. I cannot praise them enough. I do not know whether I am allowed to name individuals I have had most interactions with but suffice it to say they know who they are . And I'm not simply counting the clinical staff in that statement I also wish to thank all the office / admin staff. 

I would not hesitate to recommend Alexander House to anyone who needs help but may be hesitant due to maybe having negative experiences with MH services in the past. 

I must now quite simply state that I give this team and ancillary staff what they deserve and 5 stars are nowhere near enough.

readBy.name: Tees, Esk and Wear Valleys NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very Poor
body: I signed up to this surgery last year & yet to see my GP. I have no idea what the inside of the surgery looks like and the appointment service is diabolical. I had a smear test booked for a Monday morning, on the Sunday night I can on my period so at 8am (the time the surgery supposedly opens) I called the surgery to cancel and reschedule the appointment. I was number 20 in the queue, on the phone for 45mins & still in the queue, appointment missed. I have never experienced anything like it, the waiting time is unacceptable. As a new patient I would definitely stay clear of this surgery, they don’t seem to care about their patients or the time it takes to get in contact with them. I am absolutely disgusted in the service. Something definitely needs to change asap.

title: Getting connected
body:
Had to surgery on behalf of my wife, 35 minute's to get through to receptionist,  need I say more. 
Only reason I have given 2 stars is the receptionist was extremely efficient.

title: Professional and Polite
body:
I had a positive experience. I was greeted by the HCA who introduced herself and explained the whole process. Both staff members were very polite.
Overall was very satisfied with my experience.

title: Great practice
body: Great practice with excellent staff. Made me feel comfortable and I would definitely recommend this service to other patients.
